title: How to Do the Honda Navigation Update with a DVD

steps.title: Honda Navigation System Updates are released annually and currently come on a DVD.
steps.content: Honda Navigation System Updates are released annually and currently come on a DVD. You will need to purchase the latest disc version from Navteq. Once your new Honda Navigation DVD arrives in the post, you can proceed to the installation process below.

steps.title: The navigation system should boot up.
steps.content: The navigation system should boot up.

steps.title: On most Honda navigation systems, this will be in the dashboard.
steps.content: On most Honda navigation systems, this will be in the dashboard. On older models, this can be found underneath the passenger seat.

steps.title: The navigation system's screen will ask if you want to install new map updates.
steps.content: The navigation system's screen will ask if you want to install new map updates. So, click "yes" to proceed.

steps.title: The system will prompt you enter in your unique customer identification and serial number.
steps.content: The system will prompt you enter in your unique customer identification and serial number. This can be found on the DVD packaging, so keep it close to hand.

steps.title: The new maps will start to load into the navigation system.
steps.content: The new maps will start to load into the navigation system. The process should take no longer than 20 minutes. Once loaded, you're good to go.
